alert.note: Alert for Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 12:01PM CDT until May 17 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow Wing Counties. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Aitkin and Crow Wing Counties. St. Louis River At Scanlon affecting Carlton County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Louis River At Scanlon. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Minor flooding occurs near Scanlon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Monday, May 16 the stage was 10.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage so far this spring occurred Saturday evening and was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet Tuesday, May 17. It is then expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.2 feet on 04/08/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 10.7 Mon 9 am CDT 10.8 10.2 9.6 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1130 AM CDT.
